accordion_starting_functionality=”closed”][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What is Slush about?”][vc_column_text]Slush is a student-driven, not-for-profit movement on a mission to create and help the next generation of groundbreaking entrepreneurs, originally founded to change attitudes toward entrepreneurship.

The Slush 2023 event features two days full of stage programs in addition to over 300 Side Events, mentoring, meetings, and afterparties (duh). Our speaker line-up includes successful founders, world-class investors, and other startup and tech influencers.

Slush has grown from a single event in Helsinki to a one-of-a-kind community and series of Slush’D events organized all around the world.

Node by Slush is our online founder community that includes workshops and 1-on-1 startup-investor meetings.

Read more about us here.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”When is Slush 2023 organized?”][vc_column_text]The event will take place on Nov 30–Dev 1, 2023 at the Helsinki Expo and Convention Center (Messukeskus). The address is Messuaukio 1, 00520 Helsinki, Finland.

However, be sure to fly in earlier, as the concept of “Slush week” is no joke. For example, Founders Day, Investor Day and Media Day are all taking place a day before the main event on Nov 29, which you do not want to miss. These are exclusive events curated specifically for your ticket category, and are essential to the Slush experience.

Also, don’t forget about our legendary afterparty taking place directly after the main event on Dec 1 and continuing into the wee hours of the following day, so we suggest you journey home on Saturday, Dec 2.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Where is Slush organized?”][vc_column_text]Slush is organized in the Helsinki Expo and Convention Center. Address: Messuaukio 1, 00520 Helsinki Helsinki Expo and Convention Center is located just a few kilometers from the Helsinki city center – you’ll be able to arrive at the venue within 15 minutes from all around the city.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What is the Matchmaking Tool?”][vc_column_text]The Slush Matchmaking Tool is our in-house tool that gives you an opportunity to book meetings with the most relevant people for you. You can scroll and filter through attendees, book meetings, and chat. A table at our dedicated Meeting Area is included for the meetings.

Access to Matchmaking is included in all of our ticket types.

Access the Matchmaking Tool by having an assigned Slush Pass in your name, and by logging into the Slush Platform.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Does Slush provide ticket discounts?”][vc_column_text]We do not provide discounts outside our ticket campaigns. We recommend students join as volunteers to get access to Slush 2023. Check out our Slush for Volunteers page for more info.

If you’re interested in attending Slush with a larger delegation and purchasing partner activities, such as a booth at the event, drop us a line at partners@slush.org.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What and where is Siipi?”][vc_column_text]Siipi is the official Side Event venue located in the same building as Slush. You can access Siipi easily from within the Slush Venue by following the signage or entering through the separate Siipi entrance at Rautatieläisenkatu 3. Side Event visitors without a Slush badge are asked to use this entrance.

The following Side Event venues are inside Siipi:

  • Säde
  • Valo
  • 101AB
  • 101C
  • 101D
  • 102
  • 103A
  • 103B
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-2-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_direction_desktop=”default” column_element_spacing=”default” desktop_text_alignment=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_backdrop_filter=”none” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” column_position=”default” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” animation_type=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid” column_padding_type=”default” gradient_type=”default”][toggles style=”minimal_small” accordion=”true” accordion_starting_functionality=”closed”][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What are Slush Side Events?”][vc_column_text]Originally a two-day event, Slush has now become an entire week of exhilarating programs around the Helsinki metropolitan area. In addition to the events organized by Slush, including our Slush Official Side Events (SOSE), there is a wealth of industry and theme-specific gatherings around Helsinki all adding up to the Slush experience.

Find all Slush Side Events on the Slush Platform.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Where can I see Slush Code of Conduct?”][vc_column_text]You can find our Slush Code of Conduct here.

We want Slush to be a 100% positive experience for all of our attendees from the beginning till the end. This is why we do not accept any kind of disrespectful behavior at any of our events. Let’s make sure that all of us can have a great time regardless of what we look like, where we come from, and who we are.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”How do I contact the Slush team?”][vc_column_text]You can reach the team by email:

General inquiries hello@slush.org

Tickets tickets@slush.org

Startups startups@slush.org

Investors investors@slush.org

Partners partners@slush.org

Media media@slush.org

Speakers speakers@slush.org

Marketing marketing@slush.org

Slush’D global@slush.org

Node by Slush node@slush.org[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”How can I access the Matchmaking Tool?”][vc_column_text]The Matchmaking Tool can be found on the Slush Platform when you log in. You will have access to it once you have a Slush Pass.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Where and when can I exchange my ticket for a badge?”][vc_column_text]You need to have both your badge and wristband to access Slush.

You can exchange your ticket for a badge and wristband at any of our Badge Claim points before the event. See locations and opening hours below.

accordion_starting_functionality=”closed”][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”How can I get a ticket to Slush?”][vc_column_text]Slush 2023 is sold out. Please join the waitlist, and we’ll inform you if any tickets are released.

Purchase your ticket to Slush 2023 through the Slush Platform. If you are buying a startup, investor, or angel investor pass, we will first ask you to register your company, after which the Slush Team will review your profile and grant you access to purchase your ticket given that you meet the requirements. Attendee and Friday passes are available for all to purchase.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What are the different ticket types?”][vc_column_text]Our available ticket categories include Startup, Investor, Angel Investor, Attendee, and Friday Passes. In addition to those, journalists can apply for a Media Pass.

Startup Pass

Our Startup Pass is tailored for young, often tech-driven, companies aiming for rapid growth with a scalable business model. Please remember that each team member needs their own ticket to attend. Requires an application.

Investor Pass

Our Investor Pass is for individuals working for entities making direct investments in startups or venture capital funds – VCs, CVCs, LPs, Family Offices, and M&A Investors. Requires an application.

Angel Investor Pass

The Angel Investor Pass is suitable for individuals investing directly from their personal wealth or as a part of a syndicate. If you represent an institutional entity, please opt-in for the Investor Pass. Requires an application.

Attendee and Friday Passes 

Attendee and Day 2 Passes are for people who are not startup founders or operators, investors, or media. Buying one does not require an application.

Media Accreditation

Slush Media Passes are for journalists/editorial members of the press only.

Communications and PR professionals, bloggers, and non-editorial employees of media companies are kindly advised to get an Attendee or Friday Pass.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”How can I pay for my ticket?”][vc_column_text]

Slush uses Stripe Payments Europe Ltd for payment processing, which accepts payments from credit cards with global payment options (Visa, MasterCard & American Express).

Contact tickets@slush.org if you’ve got any questions about payment methods.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Where can I find my tickets?”][vc_column_text]

You can see your tickets and assign tickets to other people by logging into the Slush Platform.

If the ticket has been assigned to you by someone else, you will have received a confirmation email about this. When logging in, use the specific email address to which you have received the confirmation.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Can I buy passes on behalf of my team members/colleagues?”][vc_column_text]Yes. When buying on behalf of another person, you must assign their tickets through the Slush Platform on any date before the official Slush event starts.

We recommend you do this well in advance to allow your colleagues to make the most of the Matchmaking Tool and hear about updates regarding the event.

You must also assign your own ticket to yourself to access the Matchmaking Tool.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-2-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_direction_desktop=”default” column_element_spacing=”default” desktop_text_alignment=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_backdrop_filter=”none” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” column_position=”default” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” animation_type=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid” column_padding_type=”default” gradient_type=”default”][toggles style=”minimal_small” accordion=”true” accordion_starting_functionality=”closed”][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Can I transfer my ticket to another person?”][vc_column_text]

Yes, you can assign your ticket to another person by logging into the Slush Platform.

Please note that this is possible only before the event when the badge hasn’t yet been printed out.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”When and where can I collect my Slush badge?”][vc_column_text]You need to have both your badge and wristband to access Slush.

You can exchange your ticket for a badge and wristband at any of our Pre-badge claim points before the event. See locations and opening hours below.

We strongly recommend getting your badge and wristband in advance from the Pre-badge Claim to avoid queuing. The points will be quietest on Nov 28, and busiest on Nov 29.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Is there a possibility for a refund if I am not able to come?”][vc_column_text]

Unfortunately, the tickets are non-refundable.

If you can find someone who can attend the event instead of you, it’s possible to transfer the ticket to another person as long as the change has been before the event. You can transfer your ticket to another person by logging in to the Slush Platform.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Do I need to print my ticket?”][vc_column_text]No, all Slush tickets are electronic. Töölönlahdenkatu 4, 00100 Helsinki

  • Wed, Nov 29, 9 am–8 pm

This Pre-badge Claim point is accessible.

Please note: You will be asked to present a pictured ID when picking up your badge and wristband for safety reasons.

Badge Claim is also available upon your arrival at the main event venue, Messukeskus, during the event days. We have Badge claim points at both the Southern and the Northern entrances.

We strongly recommend getting your badge and wristband in advance from the Pre-badge Claim to avoid queuing. The points will be quietest on Nov 28, and busiest on Nov 29.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Does Slush provide ticket discounts?”][vc_column_text]We do not provide discounts outside our ticket campaigns. accordion_starting_functionality=”closed”][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”When should I get to Helsinki?”][vc_column_text]The event will take place on Nov 30–Dev 1, 2023 at the Helsinki Expo and Convention Center (Messukeskus).

However, be sure to fly in earlier, as the concept of “Slush week” is no joke. For example, Founders Day, Investor Day and Media Day are all taking place a day before the main event on Nov 29, which you do not want to miss. These are exclusive events curated specifically for your ticket category, and are essential to the Slush experience. This being said, we hope you fly in the night of Nov 28, or even earlier if you want to explore our 300+ side events taking place all throughout the week.

Also, don’t forget about our legendary afterparty taking place directly after the main event on Dec 1 and continuing into the wee hours of the following day, so we suggest you journey home on Saturday, Dec 2.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Where is the closest airport?”][vc_column_text]Helsinki Airport is our local airport where all the flights to Helsinki will land. It is located 20km away from Helsinki city center with excellent bus, train, and taxi connections. The airport has been voted the second-best airport in Europe.

Check out more information from the airport website.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Can you help with the visa invitation letter?”][vc_column_text]Slush can help with visa applications by providing a visa invitation letter. Contact tickets@slush.org for this matter. Read more about Finland’s visa policies on the website of the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_direction_desktop=”default” column_element_spacing=”default” desktop_text_alignment=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_backdrop_filter=”none” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” column_position=”default” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” animation_type=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][toggles style=”minimal_small” accordion=”true” accordion_starting_functionality=”closed”][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Can I get hotel discounts in Helsinki?”][vc_column_text]Our carefully curated Guide to Helsinki 2023 is here with accommodation deals and the best recommendations on what to do and see in Helsinki. The Guide will be updated throughout the fall, so stay tuned on our socials for more, or subscribe to our newsletter.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”How do I get to the Slush 2023 venue?”][vc_column_text]The venue Messukeskus, Helsinki Expo and Convention Center is located in Pasila, just a few kilometers from Helsinki city center. The address is Messuaukio 1, 00520 Helsinki.

Messukeskus is served by excellent transport connections in all directions: the easiest being one stop by train from Helsinki Central Railway Station. Trains A, P, R, and U leaving from Helsinki Railway Station all stop at Pasila.

You’ll also be able to access the venue by tram 9 as well.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Is Slush accessible by wheelchair?”][vc_column_text]The venue is fully accessible by wheelchair. You can find more information about accessibility at the venue on the Convention Centre’s website.

The venue’s two main entrances, the Southern and the Northern Entrance both have automatic doors for easy access. All floors at Slush can be accessed by lift, and have an easy-access toilet. Most of the restaurants at Messukeskus also provide easy access. The northern entrance is best for arriving by car.

Parking

During the events, parking is free for people who have a disabled parking permit. The lowest P1 level of the car park near the northern entrance has 20 parking spaces marked for the disabled. The users of disabled parking must declare their vehicle registration plate number to the Messukeskus customer service point. Also, the hotel parking area is free for disabled persons during the events.

Wheelchair spots at the stages

We have dedicated wheelchair spots in the audience at each stage. Please ask our Customer Success Volunteers to guide you to those spots. You can find Customer Success Team for example at the Info Points marked in the event map. You can also recognize them by their Info pins.

Entry is free for personal assistants. When arriving at the venue, please visit the ticket helpdesk next to the badge claim point to claim the ticket.

Guide and assistance dogs are welcome at Slush.

Accessible Pre-badge Claim points:

  • Oodi
  • Tripla
  • The Helsinki-Vantaa Airport Arrivals Hall

  • Discover any registered Slush visitor, startup, or investor based on your search criteria 
  • Book and manage meetings 
  • Have 30-minute meetings with prospective investors in the Meeting Area.
  • Chat with people prior to the meetings 

However, the Matchmaking Tool of Slush does not automatically offer virtual meeting capabilities. Of course, attendees are still free to set up virtual meetings once connected through the Matchmaking Tool.

Our Matchmaking Tool 2023 is coming soon, stay tuned.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”My company would like to announce something at Slush. What should I do?”][vc_column_text]

Every investor must apply for an investor company profile on the platform before gaining access to purchase them. This process ensures that investor tickets are reserved for actual investors. Once your application is approved, you can proceed to purchase you Investor ticket as long as tickets are available.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Do I get a bulk discount when purchasing many investor tickets?”][vc_column_text]Unfortunately, we are not able to offer any discounts on our tickets. Contact media@slush.org for more information.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What is Investor Day?”][vc_column_text]

Our Investor Day is an exclusive gathering to kick off your Slush days. Focused on connecting investors through peer-to-peer roundtables, venture-focused stage program, and free-form networking, this is the largest side-event for Investors during the Slush week that you don’t want to miss.

Investor Day is fully booked. Please sign up for the waitlist.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Is it possible to register for Investor Day?”][vc_column_text]Investor Day is fully booked. Please sign up for the waitlist.

If you’re looking for alternative events on Day 0, we recommend you check out our Side Event Tool.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”When and where is Investor Day?”][vc_column_text]Investor Day will take place at the Slush Venue (Messukeskus) at Messuaukio 1, Helsinki.

Doors will open at 1 pm, and program lasts until 5 pm. For more details visit our Investor Day page.

accordion_starting_functionality=”closed”][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Why should I go to Slush as a media representative?”][vc_column_text]Year after year, journalists, opinion leaders, podcasters, and writers come to Slush(y) Helsinki in November to find the best startups and write their next hit piece. If this is your first time, we have 3 reasons why you should join us this year.

Discover stories worth telling
Slush is the most founder-focused event on earth, bringing over 5,000 international startup founders and operators to Helsinki. Coming as a journalist, content creator or podcaster allows you to hear about cutting-edge innovations before it’s released, ask all the questions you have directly to the founders, and break the news before anyone else.

Trendspotting
Slush is THE hotspot for emerging trends in the tech and startup landscape. By coming to Slush, you get to find out about the development of new technologies and research results for the next year.

Everyone is here
Whether you want to interview that high-profile speaker you’ve been chasing for weeks or the upcoming founder who will make it big with a groundbreaking idea, Slush is the right place for you.


[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Who can get a Media Pass?”][vc_column_text]Slush Media Passes are intended for journalists and editorial members of the press. We have a limited number of Passes available and therefore prioritize outlets with a significant following and journalists who show a track record of writing about startups, technology, or venture capital.

Freelancers, podcasters, bloggers, and other individual contributors are also welcome to apply but will be screened more thoroughly for relevance.

Communications and PR professionals and non-editorial employees of media companies are kindly advised to purchase an Attendee Pass.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”How can I find news during Slush?”][vc_column_text]At Slush, we’ve made it easy for you to find news for your next piece:

  • Join our main event’s stage program and get to know our fantastic speakers.
  • Be part of the exclusive Media Day (Nov 29) to hear Slush’s speakers before anyone else.
  • Get ready for 5 unique Stage Announcements, followed by exclusive Press Q&A sessions created just for the media.
  • Explore our Media Bank, your go-to spot for the latest announcements, media kits, and contact details.
  • Plus, make the most of our in-house Slush Matchmaking Tool, designed to help you message the speakers, founders, and investors you have been eager to meet and interview.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Where can I find photos from Slush?”][vc_column_text]All Slush photos can be found here.

Publications, articles, and all non-commercial Slush-related usage of our photos and videos are allowed when crediting the photographer or videographer and mentioning that the photo or video is from Slush.

You are not allowed to edit the photos or videos or to use them for commercial purposes. If you want to use the photos or videos for commercial use, get in touch with us.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Can I bring my wireless equipment?”][vc_column_text]Yes, you’re welcome to bring your wireless gear with you! However, to make sure everything runs smoothly in the Slush Media Area, we’d love to know a bit more about your wireless equipment.

Your details help us manage radio frequencies, reducing interference and making sure everyone stays connected.

A few things to note:

  • Try to use wired devices whenever possible
  • We cannot guarantee the frequencies
  • All wireless devices must be approved in advance

You can easily register your equipment here. If you have questions, feel free to drop us a line at media@slush.org.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_direction_desktop=”default” column_element_spacing=”default” desktop_text_alignment=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_backdrop_filter=”none” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” column_position=”default” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” animation_type=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][toggles style=”minimal_small” accordion=”true” accordion_starting_functionality=”closed”][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Who are the speakers coming to Slush?”][vc_column_text]You can discover all the speakers coming to Slush in our Speaker Page. Note that we publish new speakers regularly and that the Slush agenda will launch in the upcoming weeks. [/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”How can I book interviews with Slush attendees?”][vc_column_text]The best and most efficient way to book interviews at Slush is through our Matchmaking Tool. You can search for people, startups, investors, and other attendees and filter them based on your interests. You can book the interviews directly on the tool to the Slush Media Area and chat with the participants in advance.

You can access the Matchmaking tool on the Slush Platform.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What activities will be available to the media?”][vc_column_text]We’ve got many exciting opportunities just for the media!

  • Media Day (Nov 29) is a media-only event where you’ll get an exclusive taste of the hottest topics at Slush 2023 from global tech leaders before anyone else. Register here!
  • We will run 5 unique Stage Announcements around groundbreaking news and research results, after which you’ll have access to a Press Q&A to ask your follow-up questions.
  • We will have a bigger Media Area in the main event venue with pre-bookable interview and podcast pods, working tables, and a silent streaming area.
  • You’ll have exclusive access to our Media Bank, which will feature all the information you’ll need to create your next piece successfully: from the latest announcements to the media kit and contact details. Available later this year.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”How can I find more insights and data about Slush Attendees?”][vc_column_text]Slush 2023 will gather 13,000 founders, investors, and media this year on Nov 30–Dec 1 in Helsinki. However, we understand you may need a little more information to convince your editor to join us — don’t worry, we got you.

Slush 2023 in numbers:

  • 5,000 startup operators and founders
  • 3,000 global investors, mainly from Europe and the US
  • 300 media representatives
  • 160 tech leaders in Slush stages
  • Dozens of partners
  • In 2022, Slush held over 16,000 meetings in two days. That means, that at least every single attendee met someone relevant during their time here. But you don’t have to believe us, examples speak for themselves. Check out some of our success stories.


[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Where can I work during Slush?”][vc_column_text]

  • If you’re attending Slush 2023, you have a special spot waiting for you right in the heart of Helsinki. Maria 01, the Nordics’ leading startup campus offers journalists a dedicated space to work from during the week. Book your own desk here.
  • At Slush 2023, you’ll have exclusive access to the Slush Media Area, where you’ll discover workstations, tables, interview spots, and podcast pods to make your week even more productive and enjoyable.
